Title: To what extent could we detect field defects? An extended empirical study of false negatives in static bug-finding tools
Published: Proceedings of the 27th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Automated Software Engineering
Elements_risk_assessment: They look manually if a pc is a BIC or not. GOOD!
UseOF-SZZ: They extract bugs and the faulty lines of code that are responsible for them
Summary: To what extent could field defects be found and detected by state of the art static bug-finding tools?. They analyze 3 bug finding tools on three diferent programs
Outcome: Although many field defects could be detected by static bug finding tools, a substantial proportion of defects could not be flagge. FindBugs and PMD are the best among the three bug findings tools in preventing false negatives
